'Bacillaceae' is a family of Gram-positive, heterotrophic, rod-shaped bacteria
that may produce endospores. Bergey's Manual of Systematic Bacteriology (2
ed.), Volume 3. 2008. The low G + C Gram-positive Bacteria. Editors: De Vos, P.,
Garrity, G., Jones, D., Krieg, N.R., Ludwig, W., Rainey, F.A., Schleifer, K.-H.
and W.B. Whitman. ISBN 0-387-95041-9 Motile members of this family are
characterized by peritrichous flagellae. Some Bacillaceae are aerobic, while
others are facultative or strict anaerobes. Most are non-pathogenic, but
[[Bacillus]] species are known to cause disease in humans.
